FeedItems.Title: NuGet 1.7 Released
FeedItems.Summary: We’re happy to announce that we released NuGet 1.7 today. This release includes several new features as well as over 75 bug fixes. Details are in the NuGet 1.7 Release Notes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Comparison on older product tools in nuGet" (#7030) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, you are posting in the correct issue tracker.
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

## Frequently Asked Questions

* **I want to delete my package** - please contact support instead via the [NuGet.org website](https://www.nuget.org)
* **I am having connectivity issues** - include an MTR and/or Fiddler trace - steps to capture this are [in our FAQ])(http://docs.nuget.org/consume/nuget-faq#managing-packages-in-nuget.org)

## All set!

Remove this template content and create your issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improper cleanup after package sync validation failure" (#6570) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "Deprecation: Unknown CVEs should be created in an unlisted state when submitted" (#6953) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Users should be able to submit CVE entities with the Manage Package Deprecation form.
The backend job should then update these CVE entities.

We will not support auto-creation for CWEs because they churn much less often.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add "alternate package" autocomplete for Deprecation section of Manage Package page" (#6849) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When the user types in an alternate package ID, make an AJAX request with the package ID to get the list of versions. Show the list of versions as options as well as "Any Version".

If the package does not exist, show an error in the UI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Show deprecation status in the version history on the Display Package page" (#6954) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
In addition to the information for the current package on the top of the page, we should show basic deprecation information in the version history.

Suggestions:
- make the version red
- strike-out the version
- gray out the version
- Add another column with "Listed", "Deprecated" or "Deprecated and Unlisted"

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Implement "multi-select dropdown" or alternative for Deprecation section of Manage Package page" (#6848) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Either
1. Custom multi-select dropdown
2. Expandable panel (similar to API keys page)
3. Find open-source solution

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add "Deprecation" section to "Manage Package" page" (#6773) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "NU5104 not reported on package with PrivateAssets set" (#7803) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

VS version (if appropriate): 16.0.0 Preview 3.0

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Windows Version 1903 (OS Build 18334.1)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

```xml
<Version>0.1.0</Version>
```

```xml
<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.CSharp" Version="4.6.0-preview4.19114.7">
    <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
</PackageReference>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Install the.NetFramework packages in .NetCore projects" (#7602) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi Everyone,

I have generated the custom NuGet package for our assemblies with some dependent NuGet packages. 

NuGet package lib folder structure:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16695209/49623870-6a44d600-f9f5-11e8-8f48-4a1795d26e25.png)

Dependent NuGet package lib folder structure:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16695209/49623997-d7f10200-f9f5-11e8-81d6-d8db647f5b4a.png)

Now I have tried to install my custom NuGet package in .NETCORE projects. Packages installed successfully. But assembly not referred like I expected.

.NetFramework assembly structure - 2.4{Frameworkversion}.0.2 (For Ex: 2.4450.0.2)
.NetCore assembly structure - 2.4.0.2

I expect the assemblies like .Netframework structure in core project. Parent package assemblies added as i expected but, dependent packages assemblies added like .netcore assembly structure. But I need to add the .netframework assemblies structure from the dependent NuGet packages.

Could you please suggest me to achieve this?

Thanks,
Ganesan R.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to add binding redirects in web config through NuGet packages installation" (#7763) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@GanesanRengasamy commented on [Sun Feb 03 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6873)

Hi Everyone, 

I have prepared the sample MVC4 NuGet package for my dll with the dependent of the following NuGet packages compression.base, officeChart.base. I have installed my custom MVC4 NuGet pacakge in ASP.NET MVC project with framework version 4.5.2. After installation completed all dependent assembly entries are placed under the binding redirect tag of the webconfig file. But, I didn't add this entry in my NuGet packages and I don't aware regarding how this entries are added after install my NuGet packages. 

`<dependentAssembly>
        <assemblyIdentity name="Compression.Base" publicKeyToken="3d67ed1f87d44c89" culture="neutral" />
        <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-1.4451.0.4" newVersion="1.4451.0.4" />
</dependentAssembly>
<dependentAssembly>
        <assemblyIdentity name="OfficeChart.Base" publicKeyToken="3d67ed1f87d44c89" culture="neutral" />
        <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-1.4451.0.4" newVersion="1.4451.0.4" />
 </dependentAssembly>`

Could you please update the details regarding how this entries are placed in the web config file while install the NuGet packages. 

Also, Could you please suggest me how can I overwrite this entries from my side through NuGet packages installation like below 

`<dependentAssembly>
        <assemblyIdentity name="Compression.Base" publicKeyToken="3d67ed1f87d44c89" culture="neutral" />
        <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-1.4451.0.4" newVersion="1.4400.0.4" />
</dependentAssembly>
<dependentAssembly>
        <assemblyIdentity name="OfficeChart.Base" publicKeyToken="3d67ed1f87d44c89" culture="neutral" />
        <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-1.4451.0.4" newVersion="1.4400.0.4" />
 </dependentAssembly>`

Could you please suggest me regarding this?

Thanks,

Ganesan R.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet new -i, on two private feeds, unauthorized" (#7027) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @maracuja-juice on May 28, 2018 12:16_

I have a Template package that I published to a private feed. (let's name it "Nutshell")
I deleted this package from the "Nutshell" NuGet feed and uploaded it to a different private feed, with a newer version. (let's name that one: "Peach", "Nutshell" will get obsolete at some point)
The feeds are both hosted in VSTS.

I created a PAT with the permission of "packaging (read)" and added it to my NuGet config:
```
  <packageSourceCredentials>
    <packageSourceKey>
      <add key="Username" value="myVSTSUserNAme" />
      <add key="ClearTextPassword" value="myToken" />
    </packageSourceKey>
  </packageSourceCredentials>
```

Now when I try to install the package via `dotnet new -i` I always get the error:

```
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.200\NuGet.targets(114,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source https://nutshell.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/nutshell/nuget/v3/index.json. [C:\Users\maracujajuice\.templateengine\dotnetcli\v2.1.200\scratch\restore.csproj]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.200\NuGet.targets(114,5): error :   Response status code does not indicate success: 401 (Unauthorized). [C:\Users\maracujajuice\.templateengine\dotnetcli\v2.1.200\scratch\restore.csproj]
```

As you can see: It tries to get the package from the "Nutshell" feed (package is deleted in version 1.0) but it should get it from the "Peach" feed where the package is in version 1.2.
If I explicitly state the version (`Template.Package.Name::1.2.0`) it gets the package correctly from the "Peach" feed.
Why does it want to get it from the "Nutshell" feed by default / doesn't try out both as the same package is on both feeds? (once deleted though)
Can you reproduce this problem?

Thanks for your help. 

_Copied from original issue: dotnet/templating#1545_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The port number is being ignored when downloading package from private nuget server" (#7274) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Just making sure that somebody takes a look at the following issue, first seen at Stack Overflow, as I just hit it today myself as well (same issue, different server port):

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50392599/the-port-number-is-being-ignored-when-downloading-package-from-private-nuget-ser

Original Post from StackOverflow user follows:

I'm hosting a private Nuget server built with Nuget.Server package.

The machine is exposing port 8082. The nuget server is available via web browser on http://domain:8082/nuget, publishing works fine.

Now I'm trying to enable VS2017 to consume packages from this nuget server. After adding new package source "http://mydomain:8082/nuget", I'm able to browse my packages, but Install-Package fails. Obviously it ignores the port number when building the download link.

Here's the output:

PM> Install-Package MyPackage
Restoring packages for D:\someproject.csproj...
  GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
  GET https://www.myget.org/F/aspnetvnext/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
  GET http://mydomain:8082/nuget/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
  GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='MyPackage'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
  GET https://www.myget.org/F/aspnetvnext/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='MyPackage'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
  GET http://mydomain:8082/nuget/FindPackagesById()?id='MyPackage'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
  OK http://mydomain:8082/nuget/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 44 мс
  OK http://mydomain:8082/nuget/FindPackagesById()?id='MyPackage'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 62 мс
  GET http://mydomain/nuget/Packages(Id='MyPackage',Version='1.0.1')/Download
  OK https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 431 мс
  OK https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='MyPackage'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 441 мс
  OK https://www.myget.org/F/aspnetvnext/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='MyPackage'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 1436 мс
  OK https://www.myget.org/F/aspnetvnext/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 1471 мс
Unable to download package "MyPackage.1.0.1" из "http://mydomain/nuget/Packages(Id='MyPackage',Version='1.0.1')/Download".
Error while sending request.
  Unable to connect to remote server
  A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond <mydomain's IP here>:80

Is there a way to fix this behavior?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Reevaluate the packages lock file + transitive project versions" (#7935) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Nuget.VisualStudio API clarity" (#7563) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget.VisualStudio for nuget API in visual studio extension


Is it possible to determine, with the events of IVsPackageInstallerProjectEvents and IVsPackageInstallerEvents, when a package has been installed for a particular project ?

Is there a guarantee that there is only a single batch operation being processed at a time - there is a guarantee that BatchStart is always followed by BatchEnd before the next BatchStart ?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error NU1403: The package Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms.2.0.0 sha512 validation failed." (#7922) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/sdk:2.2.105 & 2.2.1.04 end up with different `contentHash` values for:
* Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms 2.0.0
* System.Reflection.Emit 4.0.1

https://github.com/ctaggart/froto/pull/104/commits/b337106dd23d40c516556cc72635637605cce5d6

Is contentHash broken or is this expected? Should the lock files track platform dependencies if they are expected to change?

```
PS C:\Users\taggac\github\froto> docker run -it --rm -v ${PWD}:/src -w /src mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/sdk:2.2.105 bash
```
